data.title: Love the Shrimp Fajitas!
data.text: Just ate here this week for dinner. We got the shrimp fajitas, Seafood Salsalto and Chicken Quesada. We got complementary chips and Salsa as well. This restaurant is part of Spotluck. If you like getting an extra discount on local restaurants... Download the app on your cell phone and SAVE!!! We use it all the time. Download Spotluck and use this promo code MIS5049

data.title: Place has gone South!
data.text: We visited Cacique again last night. This has been our "go-to" restaurant in Frederick for many years. Something has changed, and not for the better. Our previous visit in August was disappointing, but last night was really the "last straw". Our waiter lied to us, when we questioned the dish that he brought out. I asked for the menu to show him the entree we ordered and he said he would have to talk to the chef. He did return with the correct entree eventually. The food was only ho-hum and when the bill came, the waiter "inadvertently" left on the wrong item along with the correct orders. Then realized his mistake, and when questioned about it, he admitted that he had erred, after insisting that the chef was wrong. One lie to cover another. We will not be returning!

data.title: Mariscos & Margartitas, o My!!!
data.text: Restaurant is larger than it appears from outside and really offers some nice booth dining which is hard to find in downtown Frederick.  The margaritas are absolutely deliciously cold and I had the mariscos which was hearty and so full of fresh seafood, I could hardly finish it.  Very nice option to get off the path and just go somewhere and feel hidden from the Frederick bustle.

data.title: Great waiter and food
data.text:
We had a wonderful waiter, Samei at Cacique. We had a slight time constraint and our waiter was very understanding. He was extremely helpful and friendly and took great care of us. 
The food was delicious and hot. We had an excellent experience.

data.title: Consistently Good
data.text: Never disappointed with the cuisine.  The seafood soup is a must on a cold winter day.  Only place I can get a decent chili relleno for miles.

data.title: Excellent menu and delicious food!
data.text: My husband and I had lunch here last week. The menu has wonderful selections of both Mexican and Spanish food. I had the pistachio encrusted salmon with steamed vegetables. It was excellent! My husband has a seafood Caesar salad that had so much seafood! The shrimp were huge, the scallops as well, and the Tilapia was also plentiful. The service here is very attentive and friendly. Also- even for lunch- the tables have tablecloths and cloth napkins- very classy. We would eat here again! Oh- I forgot- the wine selection is also very good

data.title: Decent Spanish/Mexican fare
data.text: It is a large restaurant with ample indoor space and a few tables outside. They have a wide range of offerings both on the Spanish and the Mexican side. Food is decent, nothing extraordinary but not bad either. Service is very friendly and efficient.

data.title: One of three restaurants
data.text: This is one of three restaurants managed and owned by the same owner.    Many of the same menu items can be found in all three locations.   I must admit - I do like Mexicali Cantina better - both for the atmosphere (not quite as noisy and you can get a private room as well...) and the food.   I've had the same dish at all three locations and Mexicali Cantina was the best.    The owner is a very pleasant fellow who we've met several times.    It's worth visiting all three of their restaurants as there are some different menu items at each.   The Paella is delightful.    If you like Paella  - try it here -  it is very good!

data.title: Excellent!!
data.text: Had never been here before, but tried it because the only parking space I found was in front of the restaurant. This place is a gem! The food is hot and fresh and prepared perfectly. The service is fast, competent and friendly. Our water glasses never got below half-full. The margaritas were generous and wonderful! The prices were very reasonable for Fredrick due to the many high-end restaurants around.

data.title: Still good
data.text: We try to eat here anytime we are in the area.  We have never been disappointed yet.  My wife eats nothing but the Spinach Enchilda's as she can seem to find them anywhere else.  Also had the Garden Talapia, absolutely delicious.  Our waiter, Elias, was friendly and attentive.  Great place to eat.

data.title: Good for large groups
data.text: This place is one of the few in downtown frederick with ample seating. We've been here for business dinner and were able to sit with 20 people together. Typical Mexican restaurant with plenty to choose from. I actually like their fish plates a lot. Decent prices for downtown, although Fajita Grande and Casa Rico are just as good and even cheaper if you venture out of downtown. My only complaint about here is that twice I've sat at the bar with friends and ordered whiskey neat and gotten a blank look from the bar tender. I had to explain what that meant, which is weird since it's like bar tending 101... happy hour specials are pretty good though!

data.title: I love this place!
data.text: Whenever I'm in Frederick I always eat at Cacique. I think they have the best Mexican/Spanish food around. The resturant is very nice, linen tablecloths, quiet atmosphere, nice staff and the price is right. Their chips and salsa is the best and I  love their enchiladas too. In fact, I've never had anything I didn't like there.

data.title: Attentive and Delicious
data.text: After having sub-par Spanish fare a few nights before, we were loathe to try Cacique...yet many people in the area recommended this place, and they were spot on! The food (paella and fajitas) were delightful, the grease levels were low and the entrees were dairy free! A great, "off the beaten path" restaurant in a place where Italian food rules!

data.title: Dinner was Great
data.text: Went to Cacique with friends a couple of weeks ago, it was really good. I particularly liked that there was outdoor seating available. Just little bistro tables but it was nice. The waitstaff was great This is not so much a place to take the kiddos, it's more for a date night or girls/guys night out.

data.title: Decent Choice in Frederick
data.text: Dined outdoors at this interesting Mexican restaurant on July 4 weekend.  We had dined here previously during the Holiday season. The outdoor area of this restaurant is only two tables deep and is rather cramped.  It is a good place to people watch from. The restaurant has been busy on both weekends that we ate here.  The inside has a Mexican decor and our servers have been Hispanic on both occasions.  Service was relatively quick but not rushed, despite the crowd. Our server Andy was efficient but lacking any personality.  The food was decent, not great. For dinner I had the seafood enchilada and my wife had fish tacos, both dishes among our favorites.  Both were decent but we've had better elsewhere.  The prices are moderate and the value is somewhat low in our opinion.  Our meal with a soda, a Margarita and two entrees came to 43.93 before tip. We view Cacique as a decent dining choice when in Frederick.  The food is not bad, but it is not a restaurant to go out of your way for.

data.title: Lunch at Cacique
data.text: We haven't eaten at Cacique for a long time. This past weekend we had lunch and the food was good and very reasonable. The chocolate mousse was very good. Worth going back again. I do wish that they have more Spanish dishes on the menu. Enjoy!

data.title: Not that great
data.text:
I've been meaning to try this restaurant for a while, but was a bit hesitant because of the Yelp 3-star rating.  Yelp reviewers are indeed correct.

I would give this restaurant 2-1/2 stars, but if I can't, a 2-star rating is more accurate than a 3-star.

We had the spinach quesadilla as an appetizer, and were excited about what the entrees would be because the quesadilla was actually very good.  Well, no.  The entrees were less than appetizing.  My husband had the Laredo platter, which was just OK, but my chicken tacos al carbon were horrible.  The chicken strips were sooooooo hard!!!  And tasteless.  It seemed that they were probably frozen and cooked in the microwave.  And the tortillas were also very hard and chewy.

Regarding the service:  not so great.  We were brought our appetizer, but we didn't have plates to eat it on.  The waiter did not even check.  We took them from an empty table next to us.  My husband ordered a lager beer on draft, but he was brought a dark beer.  He drank it anyway,  but ordered a second one, stating that he wanted the lager.  The waiter said, OK, sorry, but we were still charged for both.  We did not complain and left the waiter anyway a tip (19% over the total, including tax) because we are good tippers.

We are never going back.

data.title: Just okay
data.text:
We stopped for a late lunch.  The margarita (frozen, house tequila) was nothing special; I've had better. My fish tacos were good, but forgetable. In all, it was an average meal.  My friend had the duck. He said he has had better. When I asked if he has had worse, he responded with "I've had better."  But, he ate most of it so...
The restaurant was clean and the server was attentive. I wouldn't necessarily go back if I selected the restaurant.  But if someone wanted to go, I'd tag along.

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: The food was delicious and very plentiful.  We took enough home to make another meal.  Highly recommend if you like Mexican food

data.title: Getting Better -- Service is Still Slow
data.text:
We stopped in Cacique on a Saturday night without a reservation.  The Kentucky derby was on -- the restaurant was jam packed.  Fortunately, we were able to get a table quickly.
The food is very good. I have never had an issue -- we enjoyed our fried calamari, the avocado salad is terrific, and the fajitas were very tasty.  I am a fan of chile relleno but not at Cacique -- the pepper was severely under cooked.
Service.  What can I say?  If you go, expect to be ignored.  I finished my beer and wanted a second.  It took 10 minutes to get the waiter's attention.  He returned with an empty glass, admitting he forgot what I ordered.  We had to retrieve silverware from other tables.  It took him 30 minutes to take our order.
I rate this restaurant as average overall.  The service really detracts from the quality of the food.
Go for the food, not the service.
